main event: A bright silver-like object was observed over Cambridge, Massachusetts on February 1, 1961, hovering and disappearing towards the northeast.
interesting points: The object appeared to have a streaking orange tail.
The object hovered for 4-5 hours before disappearing.
The observer believed the object was likely the planet Venus, with atmospheric conditions distorting its appearance.
The object was estimated to be between the size of a pea and a head of a pin.
The object slowly moved west before fading out into the horizon.
sighted object: a bright silver-like hovering object with an orange tail
